edited by Nicole Greenhouse to reflect additional administrative information and added archived websites. Materials in English.
New York University Archives
New York University Archives Collection of the Washington Square News
Washington Square News
RG.39.178
74 Linear Feet in 42 flat boxes, 9 reels of microfilm, and 51 bound volumes
2 websites in 2 archived websites.
1973-2017 This collection contains issues from the student newspaper the Washington Square News (established as the Washington Square Daily News), dating from 1973 to 2017. This newspaper documents life at NYU, local and national news, campus living, and student clubs. The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. This collection includes issues in their original print format as well as microfilmed copies. Some issues are bound.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Arrangement
Newspapers are arranged chronologically.
Historical Note
New York University has had many student newspapers with many different names since its founding. The Heights campus and the Washington Square campus had separate student newspapers until 1973 when the Heights campus was closed. The Washington Square News was first published in the fall of 1973, and was preceded by the Washington Square Journal.
Originally titled the Washington Square Daily News, the newspaper shortened its title in the fall of 1974. The newspaper is still being published as of 2021.
Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date; New York University Archives Collection of the Washington Square News; RG 39.178; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.
To cite the archived website in this collection: Identification of item, date; New York University Archives Collection of the Washington Square News; RG 39.178; Wayback URL; New York University Archives, New York University.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains issues from the student newspaper the Washington Square News (established as the Washington Square Daily News), dating from 1973 to 2017. This newspaper documents life at NYU, local and national news, campus living, and student clubs. This collection also contains Washington Square News's arts and culture publication, The Village Angle Magazine, dating from 1983 to 1988. The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. This collection includes issues in their original print format as well as microfilmed copies. Some issues are bound. The collection also includes the website for the publication, with crawls of the website dating back to 2013.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Researchers must consult microfilm copies for issues published between 1973 and 1987 due to the fragility of the original newspapers.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
In 2013, https://nyunews.com/ was selected by curators and captured through the use of Archive-It. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. In May 2020, https://issuu.com/nyu.news/docs/wywh/ was added. The accession number associated with this website is 2020.040.
Processing Information
In December 2020, archived websites were added as a series.
Take Down Policy
Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.
If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.
Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.

Washington Square News Archived Website: October 2013-ongoing
While You Were Here 2020 Archived Website: May 2020
Accruals
In general, the Washington Square News website was accrued quarterly. In 2020, crawling was increased to weekly. In September 2020, accruals were changed to monthly.
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
Issuu publications are currently not playable in Wayback.
Appraisal
Crawl was limited to domains and subdomains of nyunews.com in order to remain within the collection scope and data constraints. Facebook was blocked. Website was rescoped to attempt to capture issuu publications linked to the website.
Scope and Contents
The Washington Square News has been captured since 2013. There is a gap in capture of the website from 2016-2017. The website provides daily news to readers around NYU's Manhattan and Brooklyn campuses, Greenwich Village, Brooklyn Heights, and NYU's global campuses. The website offers news, culture, arts, editorial, sports coverage, photos and videos from around campus and New York City, in conjunction with the magazine, Under the Arch. In September 2020, the staff resigned from the newspaper. New articles were not added to the website until the Spring 2021 semester.
The crawls also include a capture of While You Were Here 2020, an annual magazine directed to seniors recapping their four years at NYU.The Village Angle Magazine
Scope and Contents
The Village Angle was an arts and culture magazine published by the Washington Square News in the 1980s.The Village Angle MagazineFebruary 23, 1983-May 16, 198842
